result.execSummary:
The defendant Quayvionte E Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Vehicle w/o Consent-Passenger, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(4m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: consecutive to any other sentence, STRAIGHT TIME.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution set at zero.
Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement. Court grants expungement upon successful completion of the sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Quayvionte E Moore

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Quayvionte E Moore in court.  Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court for Quayvionte E Moore.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for final pretrial.
Parties have reached a resolution. Case proceeded as a Plea and Sentencing Hearing. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNT 1: 
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
Defendant ordered to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, STRAIGHT TIME, credit of 3 days time served. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 9 MONTHS with the following conditions:

- No contact with TB
- 20 hours community service
- Restitution set at zero.

- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal. 

Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement. Court grants expungement upon successful completion of the sentence.

Court vacates the 10/5/2022 Jury Trial.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Quayvionte E Moore in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Quayvionte E Moore appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense counsel has received discovery but has not received an offer from the state. Defense counsel requests case be placed on the trial calendar. 
Any pretrial motions to be filed by the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 37.
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.

Defendant Quayvionte E Moore in court with attorney Angel L Johnson.  Defendant Quayvionte E Moore in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Quayvionte E Moore appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Quayvionte E Moore not in court.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/24/22 @ 2p
